places_with_reviews.name: Ausa Fort
places_with_reviews.address: Khandal Galli, Sambhaji Nagar, Ausa, Maharashtra 413520, India

reviews.text: Very good architecture of the fort. Bastions and walls are very much intact. Good to visit from latur. It's a land fort no need to climb.

Exploring the various sections of AUSA Fort is like stepping into a living history book. The barracks, armories, and officer quarters have been meticulously restored to their former glory, allowing visitors to envision the daily lives of soldiers who once resided within these walls. The interactive displays and artifacts further enhance the experience, offering a tangible connection to the past.

In conclusion, AUSA Fort is a gem of historical significance. Its captivating architecture, immersive experiences, knowledgeable guides, and well-maintained grounds make it a must-visit destination for history enthusiasts. Whether you're a seasoned historian or simply curious about the past, AUSA Fort will leave an indelible mark on your memory.

This is well maintained stone structure fort situated near Latur District Maharashtra, there is some encroachment inside premises of external wall of Fort, that should be remove by local government authorities. Very nice fort tourist must visit.

Beautiful historical place to visit if you are history lover. The fortification is really good. Of course as there are some bad people are there who have ruined walls by writing names, sitting on the canons put at the entrance. The fort is mainitained but still needs to take out bushes which are there in the courtyard. Not all visitors are history lovers and some of them throw plastic bottles in fort. If you want to visit fort and see it thoroughly then keep at least 2 hrs time with you. Fort entrance closes at 5.00 pm so you have to visit accordingly.

There is not much info on this fort. some mentions found during 15 & 16th century. Lesser known place .  Huge fort, has a moat around, curved entry with check points, mahal and a sadar , a mosque. 50% of the fort is covered by gulmohar, imli trees but one can use the boundary wall walkway to see the fort.

This temple is located near Ausa. Its around 20 Km from Latur. The temple is very neat and clean. After darshan you will get prasad and it could be Boondi. Ample parking available and its free.You will love the serenity of the Balaji Mandir in Latur.Nice shrine to visit .
Balaji is the lord of Money so visiting him is always attached with self greed .
Clean hygienic Hindu temple of Lord Balaji. Best place to visit for the entire family. Fun for kids. Silent and auspicious time spent

Such a nice temple near Latur, very well maintained and clean. Good choice for weekend trips. View at evening is so adorable.🙏🏻🙏🏻🌸🌸
PC- Shamsingh Dahe

We visited the Keshav Balaji Temple several times with family members. It is a beautiful, peaceful, religious place with a central Balaji temple surrounded by some small temples, green campus. There is a Hanuman temple and a big Hanuman  statue on top floor. Recently, a function hall, a function lawn,   some rooms are added for marriage like ceremonies. It is approximately 20 kms from Latur.

Peaceful and Pious place for those who are staying near Latur and who want a spiritual break with family and friends...kids can also enjoy a small horse ride... please do spend and donate generously to help keep the place running.

The peaceful temple is located in Ausa city, which is approximately 22 kilometers away from Latur. There are 4-5 temples 🛕 surrounding the main Bajali temple. This place is situated on the outskirts of Ausa. Currently, there is a lot of ongoing construction in the temple area.

The nearest attractions include:

Keshav Park
Balaji Temple
Hanuman Temple

Excited to share about my recent visit to the beautiful Balaji Temple Ausa 🙏 Located in Maharashtra, India, this temple is a true gem with its stunning architecture and peaceful surroundings. I was truly amazed by the spiritual experience and tranquility that I felt while exploring this sacred place.

If you're looking for a place to connect with your inner self and experience divine energy, I highly recommend visiting Balaji Temple Ausa. #TempleTravel #SpiritualJourney #SacredSites #TravelInspiration

Good place for small outing, very peaceful temple atmosphere, not much scenery around, the temple is in barren land but gardening has been developed, lot of spots to click pictures , few activities for kids like horse ride and electronic car ride.very few options to eat.
They are developing surrounding area in anticipation of huge commercial profit in coming years.
But for now, a good place to visit
